itemDescription: Countess of Limerick (1897–1981), leader of the British and International Red Cross movements

wikipedia_page.main: Angela Olivia Pery, Countess of Limerick, CH GBE DStJ (1897–1981) was a leader of the International British Red Cross movements.

response: Pery was the son of Edmund Pery, 5th Earl of Limerick and Angela Pery.The Earl of Limerick, Daily Telegraph, 14 January 2003, Retrieved 4 Feb 2017 Pery was educated at Eton College and New College, Oxford. As he left Oxford his father told him "You have unfortunately been born with a prefix to your name, and unless you get an equivalent number of suffixes people will assume you are a fool". So among other things he became a chartered accountant. Pat Limerick was a noted athlete and he skied for the House of Lords against the House of Commons.

* Angela Pery, Countess Limerick, Deputy Chairman of the JWC, appointed Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire (CBE) in 1942, appointed DBE in 1946A. M. Bryans, 'Pery , Angela Olivia, countess of Limerick (1897–1981)', rev. Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, Oct 2008 accessed 4 Feb 2017
